channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Intermittent fault on pushbutton, 28th April
item.description:
The pushbutton on the control box on the southerly side (Market St side) of the pedestrian crossing here seems to have a fault, which may be getting worse. A few weeks ago I pressed the button and it turned red, but a good while later the lights still hadn't changed, and I noticed the red light around the button had gone out, so I had to press it _again_. Yesterday I kept a close eye on it, and the red light extinguished _four_ times, i.e. I had to press the button _five_ times before the crossing actually stopped the traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Gloucester Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
On the pavement outside 87 Millham Road. This is the third time the bin lorry has damaged the pavement outside my house In less than 12 months.

item.title: Blocked drain, 28th April
item.description:
The drain pictured here is blocked as are a number of drains that are located around the roundabout. Would be good if all were looked at in the locality as must of the road gullies are already full of leave litter a mere couple of months since the road was resurfaced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 28th April
item.description:
On Montpellier Spa Road near the one entrance to the pathway of the gardens there is a blocked drain causing a flood of up to 20 meters regularly reaching the middle of the carriageway causing cyclists to head into oncoming traffic when turning left.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Spa Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 28th April
item.description:
After mild rain there always seems to be a lot of surface water that reaches the middle of the carriageway and causes cyclists etc to take avoiding action into oncoming traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Market Street, St Paul’s, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocked drain, 28th April
item.description:
The drain outside the church is blocked following the road being resurfaced upwards of 2 years ago. It seems to be blocked with tarmac and regularly floods the crossing area. It may have been reported back in late 2023 and still it hasn't been sorted out which is a concern considering it's location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Saint James Square, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Blocked drain- continues problem, 28th April
item.description:
By play park. Cars have to swerve to avoid this and the grass is damaged because of it. This has been previously reported and nothing done. The state of Cheltenham streets and pavements are shockingly bad, local residents are ashamed and you do NOTHING.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Crescent, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Flooding, 28th April
item.description:
Apparently this was looked at by highways Well obviously it wasn’t I shall be making a claim as to unable to get out of our drive like last time with the water ingress nearly into our houses How can we visit our disabled parents and daughter This is Rediculous Glebe road no 22-21 prestbury Just do your job the soak away on the green isn’t working How many times do I have to say It’s just not acceptable in today society

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Chiltern Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
